newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Mondragon Q1 net seen at 201 mln pesos.
newsitem.headline: Mondragon Q1 net seen at 201 mln pesos.

text.p: Mondragon International Philippines Inc said on Monday it expected to post a net income of 201 million pesos in the first quarter of the year from 104 million pesos in the same period last year.
In a statement to the Philippine Securities and Exchange Commission, the firm said gross operating profit in the first three months of the year reached 241 million pesos.
"The first quarter saw our company focus its resources in its leisure and gaming business," the company said, after selling its consumer products business.
Mondragon said sales of golf and country club memberships and operations yielded the biggest net profit of 151 million pesos, while casino and hotel operations contributed the rest of the income.
The company, through a subsidiary, operates a hotel, golf and country club, and a casino inside the Clark free port area.
Mondragon said it maintained its net income forecast for 1997 at 650 million pesos which it announced at the beginning of the year.
